body_text: fixes #6

Hello, in case welcome I added some nice (hopefully others think so ü§£) badges to the README. They link to various parts of the repository and also back to the Base website, blog, docs and Twitter account. You can play with them using the README on my fork.
I've also included screenshots below to demonstrate the change, before and after. Each badge is its own commit in case you all would like to drop some but keep others. Cheers.
Before:

After:
I grabbed and copy/pasted this from https://github.com/coinbase/salus/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, assuming that might already be OK to use (since this repo didn't have it).

Similarly to PR #11 , I grabbed this from https://github.com/coinbase/salus/blob/master/SECURITY.md thinking it would be OK to use. This template simply instructs people with reports to submit them via Coinbase's HackerOne page.
Providing more information about how Base Nodes work
make a bit less output
Providing more information in README.md (edited)
Due to customer confusion, I added some clarifying comments.

The docker compose command does not work without --build flag
Volume mapping is easy

Warn developer for missing package, as original error message does not say this straight.
Another more "polluted" options is
command -v jq &> /dev/null && echo Latest synced block behind by: \
$((($( date +%s )-\
$( curl -s -d '{"id":0,"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"optimism_syncStatus"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:7545 |
   jq -r .result.unsafe_l2.timestamp))/60)) minutes || { echo "mvn is not installed" 1>&2 ; }
Reliability improvements, including fix for handling shapella L1 blocks (ethereum-optimism/optimism#5144).
Onchain is the next online.

Currently geth data is stored within the container. This means all chaindata is lost whenever the container is destroyed, for example when upgrading to the latest version using docker-compose down instead of docker-compose stop. This can be prevented by volume mounting the data directory to a directory on the host machine, which this PR proposes.

What
This updates the dockerfile and compose scripts slightly to cleanup some things and follow some best practices around docker


Remove the whole local git repo configuration that is done to build both geth and optimism repos, as it is creates unnecessary complexity.  Instead simply download github public tarballs of the sha references.  Another additional benefit is that this can use sha256sum checking on the tarballs.  In order to use ADD --checksum=sha256: you must use the docker # syntax=docker/dockerfile:1-labs https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#syntax


Cleanup /var/lib/apt/lists as this is unnecessary bloat in the image


Remove the .sh from the entrypoint files as they already have interpreters and exectuable files generally do not have extensions.


Removes the "sh" command to run the entrypoints in the docker compose file, because of the same reason, the scripts have bash interpreters


Only Copy the geth-entrypoint and op-node-entrypoint scripts and the appropriate goerli folder.  The current docker image includes all the other files in this repo due to a COPY . ., which is really not necessary


$ docker run -it --entrypoint sh mitsuwa/node:latest
# ls
CONTRIBUTING.md  Dockerfile  LICENSE  README.md  SECURITY.md  docker-compose.yml  geth	geth-entrypoint.sh  goerli  logo.webp  op-node	op-node-entrypoint.sh

The image reduction is about 20 mb
Testing
This builds the image via docker compose up --build and geth and op clients startup

docker's --env-file parsing doesn't like the trailing comments, so move them onto separate lines
minor formatting cleanup

Currently, any attempt at shutting down the container will result in a forced stop due to the app being created as its own process in the entrypoint script. Adding exec will run the app as PID 1 and handle graceful shutdowns.
Any forced shutdowns with geth or similar software usually results in corrupted and lost state that will result in syncing from a much greater timeframe on reboot.

SSD requirements 100GB -> 1 TB
Adding how to download a snapshot

This PR updates the hdd requirements and also adds snapshot info.
Currently to restore a snapshot for mainnet, it would require approximately 450GB of disk space. This would exceed the current minimum requirement of 100GB mentioned in the README, so I've updated it to 500GB 1TB.

The README is not entirely clear how snapshots are handled (eg. see related discussion on Discord). The instructions pretty much stop at downloading the file. This PR suggests adding statements that:
a) the snapshot archive needs to be decompressed
b) data directory needs to mounted

Update op-geth and op-node to the latest releases. This release contains an Optimisitic activation for Ecotone on Base Mainnet. See here for full release notes.

Description
Specify the version when building op-node, this
# Before
‚ùØ curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data \
    '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"optimism_version","params":[],"id":1}' \
    http://localhost:7545
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"v0.0.0-"}

# After
‚ùØ curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data \
    '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"optimism_version","params":[],"id":1}' \
    http://localhost:7545
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"v1.5.1-"}
